alert.note: Alert for Cass; Mason; Menard (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 3:27PM CST until February 02 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Sangamon River near Oakford affecting Cass, Mason and Menard Counties. .An ice jam will cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the river. .The following forecasts are based on observed precipitation, soil moisture conditions, forecast precipitation, and ice jam movement. There continue to be reports of an ice jam in the vicinity, so expect rapid fluctuations of 1-5 feet. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 02... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sangamon River near Oakford. * WHEN...Until Friday, February 02. * IMPACTS...At 471.0 feet, Flooding begins to agricultural areas not protected by levees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM CST Friday the stage was 471.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 PM CST Friday was 473.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 473.0 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 471.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Sangamon River Oakford 471.0 471.4 Fri 2 pm CST 472.9 472.8 472.4 &&
info.instruction: Persons with interests along this river need to remain aware of the latest forecasts and associated flood risk for their area. Stay tuned for further updates on this flooding situation. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
